articleContent.title: Chord: 11th in B (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 11th in B (Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation

The 11th chord in the key of B with an E shape is a rich and colorful chord that adds depth and complexity to music compositions. This chord consists of the notes B, E, F#, A#, and C# and is often used to create a jazzy and sophisticated sound.

## Notes and Intervals

- B (Root)
- E (5th)
- F# (11th)
- A# (b13th)
- C# (b7th)

This chord is built by stacking the 1st, 5th, 11th, b13th, and b7th notes of the B major scale.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The 11th chord in B with an E shape is commonly found in jazz and R&B music. It adds a sense of tension and resolution to a progression, bringing a unique harmonic color to the sound. This chord can create a dreamy and sophisticated atmosphere in a musical piece.

## Songs

Here are three songs that feature the 11th chord in B with an E shape:

1. "So What" by Miles Davis
2. "As" by Stevie Wonder
3. "Cantaloupe Island" by Herbie Hancock
